inn1.comm: there was nothing but flight on it, so much that it ended up a full-toss. Nudged to long-on
tossed up and drifting in at him, Kayes stays put and works to midwicket
nice and tight on middle as he draws Kayes forward to block
hint of turn and bounce with this brand new ball for Hafeez. The batsman went back and adjusted to block into the off side

edged and first slip has dropped it! Gorgeous flight and drift for Hafeez as he tosses this up on off stump. Kayes ventures forward to defend but is surprised by the turn this gets. Regulation edge but it goes to the left of slip. Ahmed Shehzad dives, gets a hand to it, but shells it.
good length ball on middle, kept out

Kayes is not looking good out there. This is a fuller delivery angled across him and he chases it. Poor choice of shot with two slips waiting for the edge. Even worse when you consider he was dropped in the previous over
fuller and outside off, he leans into another drive which falls short of cover
128kph, he's only just ambling in and pitches this full but on leg stump. Kayes looks to pick it away, but can only pad it to the keeper
slashed over the cover and this time his connection is solid. The width was the mistake on that ball and Kayes doesn't look like he wants to die wondering
full and pushed across him, Kayes gets a little more compact as he leaves the ball
good length ball outside off, not bothered with. Doesn't carry too appreciably to the keeper
solid forward defensive to the fuller delivery just outside off stump. Good discipline from both bowler and batsman there
flighted on off stump, plants his front foot across and nudges towards square leg
eased down to long-on as he gets to the pitch of the flighted delivery on off stump
this good length ball slides on with the arm and Kayes is good enough to flick to midwicket.
goes back as he sees this flatter and punches to short cover. Bit of room there
flighted on middle, met with a straight bat on the back foot
looks to push and run, but short cover is too quick. Lovely flight from Hafeez again
fullish on middle and leg, Anamul uses soft hands to knock it in front of mid-on and races across for a quick single. There is a direct hit at the bowler's end and no one is backing up in cover.
pitches it up but he's a little too straight. Picked away
bit of width and that's all Kayes needs. Flays it in front of point. Didn't bother with his feet much but his hands went through with the shot with full conviction
full and angled in on off stump, Kayes knocks it back to the bowler who deflects it to mid-off
goes back and punches to short cover. There was some room afforded to him there, but this time he neither hit it hard enough, nor did he find the gap
back of a length and probing in the channel, too close to throw his bat at it so Kayes refrains from playing.
flighted outside off, comes forward to defend with soft hands
not as well flighted so he remains on the back foot and turns it to midwicket
flighted on middle, blocks from the crease

that's a good hit. He's seen Hafeez is more interested in flighting the ball and skips down the track. Has no trouble reaching the pitch and swings with the spin. Neat strike to the midwicket boundary
length ball on off stump, punched to long-on
flighted on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
132kph, good length ball just outside off, defended
132kph, targets off stump with a good length ball. Anamul shuffles across and blocks
darts in off the pitch at 129kph, Anamul whips the good length ball to square leg.
pushes him on the back foot as this is on middle stump. Anamul is strong in defence
just short of a good length and outside off, wanted to force it away but then changes his mind and bunts to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, watchfully defended
flighted on middle and leg, lunges forward and defends off the inside edge to midwicket
goes back and clips to the left of midwicket, but the fielder dives and keeps it to none
too short and Kayes has been quite happy to punch square on the off side. This time he cuts straight to cover
stays leg side of this tossed up delivery on middle, driven to long-off
shortish and outside off, punched to long-on off the back foot

appeal for leg before, but this was sliding down leg. Flatter delivery, doesn't turn and just skids onto the batsman. Kayes is slow in bringing his bat down, but escapes. Oh dear, that was not missing the stumps at all! Crashing into leg stump!
back of a length and outside off, punched to short cover. Anamul looks rather determined out there
back of a length on middle and off, blocked
just short of a good length and in the channel, stays back and defends
good length ball on off stump, kept out
slashed in front of point! Terrific wristwork! Gul offers a bit of room on this shortish delivery and the batsman was on it in a flash. Opens the face the find the gap and powers it away
tightens his line on middle and off, Anamul pushes to mid-on
flighted on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length ball, sliding in on middle and leg. Clipped between midwicket and mid-on
big of bounce and turn there. Flighted on middle and it rises towards his waist. Anamul keeps it down with soft hands
flighted outside off, lunges forward to defend
pushed through on middle and leg. Anamul sees this sliding down and pads up
flighted on off stump, turns it to square leg from the crease
full and outside off, Anamul drives strongly to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, Anamul lets it slide off the open face to point
127kph, dug this in rather hard and gets considerable bounce. Sails over the batsman's head and the keeper had no chance to pull that back either.

whacked to the long leg boundary! He goes for another short ball, but his field is not set for this. Another bouncer, with fine leg up and Anamul takes advantage with a well-controlled pull. Got under it and helped it on its way
good length ball on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
slower ball, excellent variation. The batsman was into his shot a little too soon, trying to run it down to third man with an open face. Beats the outside edge
what is that! this one slips out of his hand and it's gone way up and way wide.. Lucky that he is a spinner

another full toss, this one is outside off and what does the batsman do, he slaps it straight to deep midwicket, Everyone is looking around to see the umpire's reaction because this could be a no-ball for height. What a filthy start! But he could get away with a wicket. This is definitely high. It's too high. It's a no ball. It's his second delivery that is too high. Last one was a beamer wide outside off. This is a beamer. This is unprecedented. He is being taken off? No, he will continue. He is fine

and a third delivery! This is definitely a beamer! Full toss on the body, slapped to midwicket boundary. But this is farcical from Rehman. First three balls, all beamer. Now he is out of the attack. Misbah's ploy of using spin has gone down the drain. Rehman's game is over. What a record this is going to be! Rehman 0-0-8-0
bowls a flat delivery outside off, it's defended to cover
repeat of the previous delivery, the batsman punches it to the bowler
stays in the crease and whips it to deep midwicket for a single
flatter delivery on the stumps, punched off the back foot to the bowler
comes forward and eases the fuller delivery to long on
comes forward and defends this one to cover
good length ball directed way outside off, slashes but misses
that's the fifty for Bangladesh. The new opening combination seems to be working. Length ball with width on offer, slapped to deep point
fullish and just outside off, pushed down to mid-off
slides down the leg side with a length ball, picks it off to deep square leg
good bouncer from Talha, this is around head-high outside off and Kayes cannot help himself but pull. No control on the stroke, but it falls just short of the rushing deep square leg fielder
fullish on middle and leg. Anamul shuffled across and was in front of all three stumps, but gets bat to this as he flicks to deep square leg
pushed through on off stump, eased through the covers off the back foot
length ball on middle, backs away and punches to long-on
what a massive strike! Cleared the long-on boundary by a distance! Flatter delivery on middle and he planted his front foot beside the ball and swung freely, but more importantly hit straight.
charges down the track and slogs to long-on. Fawad had flattened this one and pushed it outside off so he had to fetch it
goes back and nudges towards midwicket. Kayes wanted the single, hesitates, then sets off but is pushed back to his end. Never run off a misfield

tossed up on off stump, he was looking to push down to long-on and having closed the face too soon, gets a leading edge. Rehman at mid-off throws down the stumps, but the batsmen are home. Misbah pats him on the back
134kph, fullish on middle, Kayes gets a thick inside edge as he was coming forward to block
back of a length and on off stump, defends off the back foot
smacked over the top of the bowler! Picked it off a length and he's thumped it to the long-on boundary. Eyes firmly on the ball and his confidence must be sky high after that clean hit
flicked away to deep square leg as Talha continues being too straight
goes short against Kayes again and he takes it on. He miscued one in the last Talha over, but this time he gets on top of the bounce and pulls down
136kph, short ball on middle and leg, ducks under it
well flighted on off stump, Kayes keeps it out
strides forward and opens the face to guide this between point and cover. Again, tantalising flight from Ajmal
good length ball on off stump with a flatter trajectory. Anamul stays back and turns to short fine leg
tossed up outside off, draws him forward and into a defensive push
gets to the pitch of this tossed up offspinner and defends

can anyone pick his doosra?! This one is on a good length just outside off, Anamul was making room expecting to cut the offspinner, but he is left soundly beaten. Ajmal has a pleased smirk on his face. When you got it, flaunt it

this was angled across him on a fuller length, Kayes steers it behind point. Sheer timing. He was playing away from the body, but met the ball nicely and the roll of his wrists gave it surprising power
dabbed in front of point and he rushes through for a quick single.
shortish and outside off, guided to point off the back foot

top-edge and it sails over the long leg boundary! Talha's prowess with the bouncer is not unfounded, this one is on middle and it has risen around helmet-height. Anamul goes after it and tucks himself to a lucky boundary

misfield at the deep square leg boundary fives Anamul his fifty! He was cautious early on, but after the first half hour was done, he unleashed. This was full and sliding down leg. Kept his front leg out of the way and whipped it away. Maqsood overruns it on the boundary and the Mirpur crowd erupt

pulled and it's got enough to clear the ropes. This is Bangladesh's best opening stand in three years! This short ball doesn't rise high enough and Anamul's already showed he is not shy of taking on the quick. Solid pull as he rocked back
fired down the leg side on a length, runs off the front pad to short fine leg
tossed up outside off, pushed into the covers
good length ball outside off, eased into the covers
flighted outside off, makes some room and drives back to the bowler
opens the face and finds the gap between mid-off and cover. Lovely flight from Ajmal again
flighted on off stump, cautious with his defence. That will be drinks
tossed up on leg stump, clipped through square leg
flatter and on a good length on off stump, but Anamul thought there was enough room to cut.
flighted on off stump, strides forward and blocks
Tossed up on off stump, defended
shortish and outside off, cut away to the sweeper

creamed over cow corner! His feet were quick enough to race down the track to Afridi and a clean swing of the arms sends the ball into orbit. Didn't quite reach the pitch of it, but it was in the arc for the left-hander
good length ball just outside off, pushed through the covers
waits for it as this is flighted just outside off, opens the face and finds point
flighted and angled in on off stump, pushed to long-off
tossed up on middle and off, defended to mid-on
lots of flight on this as he draws the batsman forward to defend
almost a yorker on off stump, kept out
pushed through full and on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
still on the pads as Kayes works it through the vacant square leg region
goes wide of the crease and angles the fuller delivery on middle, keeps it out
works the angle as he waits on the fuller, flatter delivery and clips towards the long leg boundary.
bit of turn outside off and Anamul dabs it to the right of backward point. Waited on that nicely and opened the face to find the placement he wanted. Too short and too quick from Afridi
does not pick the googly at all! Looked to flick this one which is a little more flighted on middle and gets a leading edge to cover
hint of turn outside off, stays back and pushed to short midwicket
this time he uses a straighter bat and picks up a single to long-on
rocks back and punches this length delivery on off stump to long-off
flighted on off stump, he closes the face too early and gets an edge to cover
nudged to short midwicket as this is on a good length and on off stump
skips down the track and works this flighted delivery outside off to long-on
quick, flat and full on off stump. The Afridi triple threat and this is pushed down to long-on
he's done it again! Races down the track and hoists Afridi over long-on! Immensely quick feet from Kayes as he reaches the pitch and unleashes a full swing of the bat. This is terrific hitting
flighted on off stump, think this was the googly. Kayes defends with an open face into the covers
bit of room outside off and he dabs it in front of point
length ball on the pads, clipped behind the square leg ump
slowed this up as this length ball pitches on middle and leg. Worked away to deep square leg
flighted on middle and leg, stays deep in his crease and clips behind square leg
flighted but drifting down leg, nudged to the left of midwicket
tossed up and outside off, lunges forward to block
length ball on off, dabbed into the covers but the man had come in too quickly to go through for a single
waits on it and hits with the turn. Flighted on middle and leg and worked to the right of midwicket
tossed up and tucks him up on middle and off. Kayes defends with bat and pad close together
tossed up and targets the blockhole on leg stump, Anamul jams his bat down and directs hits to long-on
a horribly directed googly! This was pushed way down the leg side and Kayes is happy to just watch the keeper take care of this
short and wide outside off, that's his area as he rocks back and cuts behind point. Fifty for Kayes in his comeback game
tossed up outside off, whipped away to the left of deep long-on
flighted outside off, strides forward to defends towards point
loads of flight on this as Afridi temps him outside off, Anamul is forward and blocks. Gets a thick outside edge to short third man
shortish and on off stump, goes back and clips to deep midwicket
the slowness of this pitch is making its presence felt. Good length on off stump, but the batsman has to wait on the back foot and nudges to midwicket
tossed up on middle and off, defends back to the bowler
shortish and on the pads, clipped to the left of midwicket
skips down the track to reach the pitch of this flighted offspinner and pushes to long-on
opens the face and guides this fuller delivery in front of backward point
stays put in his crease and punches the good length ball outside off to cover
flighted on off stump, strides forward to block
looks to nudge into midwicket, but has played oto early. Leading edge but goes down to ground
strides forward to block the flighted delivery on off stump

ventures down the track and pushes to long-on. Midwicket should have cut across and made a better effort, but instead Maqsood just ushers it further and further. There was confusion between the batsmen as well. Afridi is terribly miffed
mid-off dives but can only get a fingertip to this. Stays leg side of the tossed up ball outside off and lashes it down the ground
short outside off, he rocks back and cuts to deep point
starts off with a slower one outside off, Kayes is almost deceived. No timing on this back foot punch to the covers
full and sliding outside off, Kayes strides forward but made sure he has enough room to drive to the left of mid-off. Not quite as well timed as he had hoped

races down the track and gets a top edge that beats the keeper! The bowler had switched to back of a length as he saw the batsman coming at him, but Anamul's aggression works to his advantage as the ball beats Akmal's outstretched right hand
good length ball on off stump, kept out
120kph, completely deceived by the slower bouncer! He was an age into the pull shot and had to check it. The ball eventually hits bat and lobs up towards short midwicket, if it had been there
back of a good length and outside off, steered to point
tossed up and angled down the leg side. Kayes looks to tickle it away but it was too wide
lots of turn for Afridi as this is flighted outside off and raps him on the pads in front of middle. Afridi asks the question, but the angle would have taken it down leg
picked away to deep backwards square leg. Kayes doing well by playing with the turn
stays on the back foot as he waits for this to pitch and turn and then cuts to deep point
loopy delivery outside off, Kayes leans forward and dives to cover
charges him but gets too close to the ball. Doesn't have enough leverage to heave this away.
carved to deep point off an open face
lovely punch, but it will not beat short cover. Stood up tall to get on top of the bounce of this shortish delivery outside off
slower short ball, pulled from outside off stump to deep square leg. That's the 150 of the partnership
138kph, fullish on leg stump. Kayes is caught in the crease as he looks to defend.

takes his time, shakes his head and then gives it! Umpire Cloete, you legend! This was the slower short ball and it deceived a charging Kayes. He tries to adjust and checks his pull shot, but Pakistan finally have a wicket. Went off the back of the bat and then off the shoulder through to the keeper
length ball, slid across him. Left alone by Mominul Haque, the new batsman
full and outside off, driven to mid-off
angled in on a good length and it turns away, Anamul shuffles across and whips in front of midwicket
flighted outside off, reaches forward and whips to mid-on
good length ball outside off, punched to mid-off
flighted on middle and leg, he is forward but keeps his front leg out of the way to drill this to long-on
drags this flighted ball from outside off with a good, solid sweep shot
flighted on off stump, defended into the covers
full on middle, but this is all about the shot. Got forward and kept his balance while essaying a brilliant whip through midwicket.
back of a length on off stump, he stays deep in his crease and dabbed to third man
strong punch to the right of short cover! This was back of a length and outside off, Anamul shifts his weight forward and bottom-hands this away almost to the cover boundary
slower, length ball outside off. Anamul has spotted it early and clipped to deep midwicket
change of pace again, this time the length is shorter. Mominul spots it a little too late and the cut doesn't connect
short and wide, he slaps it behind point. Got under the ball and helped it on it's way with a whip of those wrists again. He knows third man is fine
flighted on off stump but he stays back and dabs into the covers. Rehman is the man out there on the boundary
short delivery, turns in but it is slow. Mominul rides it and works through midwicket. More work for Rehman
flighted on middle and off, he strides forward to defend
stays leg side of this length ball and slices to deep point. That open face of the bat has come in great use for Anamul
flighted on middle and leg, he swivels in the crease and the sweep finds short fine leg
this is a bit too short and Mominul has pounced! Makes a bit of room for his slashing blade to come down strongly on the ball and he's placed it well square of deep third man
flatter delivery just outside off, cut away to deep third man
tossed up on off stump, Mominul is forward and blocks
loses his length on this one as he drags it short. Mominul is quick to pull to the man at deep square leg
punched to deep point as he waits for this length ball to come to him

hint of turn for Maqsood, but it only helps the batsman in his efforts to find the boundary. The length was a little too short again and Mominul jabs an open face at it and cuts well wide of third man
pushed through flatter and this doesn't turn. Mominul was looking for the late cut again but this sneaks under his bat
length ball on off stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
shortish but it's too straight, Mominul works it off his hips to long leg
fullish and it seems to jag back in off the pitch. Anamul defends off the front foot
back of a length and just outside off, blocked
runs the shortish ball off the open face behind point. Quick single taken
too full and too straight, Anamul clips to deep square leg.
starts off with a shortish one outside off, cut to point
length ball turning away from off stump, pushed into the covers
whipped into the midwicket region as he waits for this length ball, pitching outside leg to turn
flighted on middle, turned away through square leg
steered behind point as this is flat and outside off
drags it short and the line is down leg as well. Mominul pulls off the back foot
quicker and flatter on middle, Mominul is back and whips to midwicket
good length ball on off stump, Mominul is deep in his crease and cuts to short third man. Neat late cut
great work from Maqsood! Mominul looks to take advantage of one that is slid a little too straight. Sweeps quite strongly but short fine leg dives to his right does quite well
flighted on off stump, lunges forwrad to defend
stays back to cut, but this one turns it quite sharply. Dabbed away between point and cover
another sweep, but doesn't get hold of it as short fine leg has to move to his left to mop up. Drinks now
tossed up on off stump, kept out
goes on with the arm as Mominul picks this away to deep square leg
flatter delivery on the pads, worked to deep midwicket
shortish on off stump, but Mominul makes some room as he goes back and cuts. Maqsood is the sweeper and they take his throw on
quicker and flatter on middle and leg, whipped away behind square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
tossed up on off stump, Anamul defends off the front foot
loopy delivery outside off, Anamul plants his front foot across and nudges to midwicket
turns this flighted delivery on middle to square leg
lovely flight  from Ajmal again as he draws the batsman forward. Anamul still solid in defence
length ball on middle, picked away off his hips to square leg
fired in on middle and leg, whipped to deep midicket
flighted on off stump, defends to midwicket
Length ball on off stump, punched to long-on to bring up the Bangladesh 200 and this partnership's 50
Flighted on middle, eased to the right of short fine leg

Flighted outside off, Anamul pushes calmly to long-on and raises his hands in triumph. That's his second hundred in ODIs and Mirpur are on their feet in applause. Leaps up into the air and punches it in delight
Shortish and outside off, he stays back and cuts to short third man

Goes down leg and he tickles this away behind long leg. They want an extra run and Mominul is rushing back to the danger end. The third umpire is called in, and it seems the keeper has not collected the ball! Mominul would have been out by a considerable distance there
Charges down the track and he's holed out at deep midwicket! Hasn't picked the doosra as he was looking to up the ante. Goes down the track and hacks this away, but doesn't get any timing on this.
flighted on middle and leg, Mominul can only block
tossed up outside off, he was looking to slice it through point and gets an inside edge.
loopy offspinner outside off, cut away to point, who misfields.
leaps off the rough! It was the doosra too, Mushi was looking for an easy flick through midwicket to get off strike, but has to check his shot
goes the other way again as this is a bit more flighted. Mushi was looking to run it down to third man but is beaten soundly
short ball with ample room outside off. Mominul does not need a second invitation. That is his favourite stroke and he has placed it well wide of deep point
again, too much room outside off from Afridi and Mominul slaps it away behind point
flighted on off stump, dabbed to short third man where Fawad pulls of a lovely, diving effort. Threw off balance, but wasn't able to stop the single
fired full and outside off, Mominul's desire to cut foils him on this occasion. Far too full for the shot
tossed up outside off and he brings out a sweep, gets it to go all along the ground to deep midwicket

lovely flight outside off and Mushi has gone for a sweep. Might have been better easing that through the covers. Akmal flicks the bails off and asks the question. He had dragged the back foot outside the crease, but has slid it back almost as soon. No trouble there
he's flicked it to the right of fine leg! It was on a length and going on with the angle. All Mominul goes is pick it away off his hips
flicks away again as Gul persists with back of a length. The angle in works to the left-hander's advantage again
back of a length and on off stump, defended into the off side
lovely delivery, this was fired into the block hole. There was a bit of inswing there for him too. Mushi does well to dig it out through midwicket
low full toss outside off, Mominul lunges forward and drives to mid-off. Should have found the gap considering there are no one in the deep straight on the off side
shortish and just outside off, backs away and smears it just wide of mid-off. Doesn't time it well enough and has to settle for a single
flighted but it's down leg side. Mushi doesn't bother with it
good length ball sliding across him, Mushi goes deep into his crease and dabs it to short third man. Mominul calls his captain through for a tight single and makes it
tossed up on off stump, swept away to deep square leg. Nice long stride forward to get to the pitch

Moqsood's day in the field is not getting any better. This was the flatter doosra but Mushi has no trouble sinking to his knees and hitting across the line. Strikes it off the middle and the slog sweep races away to the right of midwicket

turn and bounce for Ajmal and both of them are sharp, but Mushi runs it fine to the third man boundary. He adjusted very well and employed soft hands to make sure he doesn't get into any sort of tangle.
full and a little too straight, turned away to square leg
room outside off and he carves this through point off the front foot to raise his fifty. Lovely, brisk innings from Mominul, but he needs to stay there longer
low full toss outside off, Muhsi keeps his front leg out of the way and slams it through extra cover.
whipped away through square leg
bouncer angled in at him. Mominul evades it in hopes that it was over his head, but it's fine
yorker on off stump, he shovels it into the covers and since the man is on the circle, there is a single on offer
and that proves too costly a gamble! This was an off-stump yorker, but Mushi has made room and has carved this to the left of cover. Mirpur is humming!
Mushi was advancing and so the bowler uses a slower short ball. Ducks under it but the ball was directed down leg
shortish on off stump, he backs away again and taps to point
flighted and turns away after pitching outside leg. Mushi's sweep shot doesn't connect as he wears it on the body. Mominul calls his through for a single though

top-edge and deep square leg swallows him up! A bit more bounce for Ajmal as the batsman goes for another sweep. The fielder dives forward to complete a simple catch. Misbah's decision to hold Ajmal back in the death seems to be working big time
skips down the track, but he's shorteneted his length. Mushi adjusts and presents a defensive bat
lap sweep to bring up the 250! Mushi has a big smile on his face. He liked that. This was tossed up on leg stump and he was already shuffling across to the off side and shoveled it over the keeper

short and it slides across him, it was the doosra again and though it gets a bit more bounce, Mushi rides it and cuts past short third man. Gul was unsure whether to go for the catch or protect the runs and in the end does neither
flighted on middle and leg, nudged into the midwicket region
seeks the blockhole outside off, Mushi flays it through extra cover and with fresh legs out there, they pick up a couple
Full toss outside off and he's slapped it through point! All it needed was a little dab and Shakib is more than good enough
Short ball outside off and he pulls to deep square leg. Slower ball foils his timing
Low full toss outside off again, Mushi sets himself up for a slog and heaves this to long-off.  Goes off the bottom of the blade that time
Slower delivery, down the leg side. Shakib swings but can't connect. The keeper dives but can't rein it in. Terrible ball so late in the innings.
Pulled to long leg! He has his fine leg up and bowls a short one outside leg stump! Shakib swivels on the back foot and tucks himself to a free hit
doosra again, tossed up on middle and off. Goes back and nudges to short fine leg

Skips down the track and hoists this over the cover field. Talha was racing in off the boundary and was covering for the ball to turn into him after pitching, but it moves the other way. He stretches out his left hand but the ball dribbles away to the boundary!
Fired in full on leg stump and Shakib has smashed this through midwicket. Another doosra, but this time it's been picked and put away
Races down the track and he's smoked Ajmal over long-off! 23 off 6 balls for the returning allrounder! That is a very short boundary there!
Length ball fired in on middle and leg, defended towards the leg side and the race through for a single
Length ball on off stump, flicked into the leg side to make it 17 off the Ajmal over
full and wide outside off, slogged to long-on
Length ball too wide outside off, slapped into the covers
Runs acorss outside off and laps it away to the long-leg boundary. Amazing stroke! He knew it was going to be full and outside off and has outsmarted the bowler!
Full and on middle, punched to long-on. That's the fifty partnership, off only 20 balls
Length ball outside off, it was the slower one as well, pulled straight to midwicket
Full and wide outside off, good choice from the bowler as he had seen Mushi make room for himself. Cant reach with the slash
Flighted on off stump, driven to long-on
creamed down the ground! Mushi gets under this flighted delivery on middle and clubbed it straight over his head

edged and it runs away to the third man boundary! Ajmal is being dismantled! This was a quicker delivery which doesn't turn and gets a bit more bounce. Mushi was late on his pull but gets a fortuitous top edge
doosra, but it's picked and he dabs it behind point for a single
skips down the track and punches towards wide long-on. Ajmal himself pings away off the bowler's crease to field this one
jumps outside leg before the bowler has bowled so Ajmal can follow him and fires in a length ball which still cramps him up

full and wide outside off, Mushi unleashes a gorgeous cover drive for only a single, but that single raises his fifty! What an innings this has been from the Bangladesh captain! His side needed momentum and he put his hand up and how!
yorker outside leg, perfect line to hamper the batsman who was making room for himself. Dug out into the off side
123kph, lapped but he hasn't timed it well. The slower delivery works this time for Gul as this bounces a little more.
moves across outside off and he's pulled it away over square leg! Rehman hustles from long leg and employs a full length dive, but as he was pushing the ball back, his back leg touches the rope.
walloped over deep midwicket! Moves outside off and this time Gul presents a length delivery. Just what the batsman wants as he swings away. This is the highest score made by Bangladesh in ODIs
full and in the slot outside off, smeared down the ground for a couple

inn2.comm: back of a length on middle, shuffles across and picked off the hips to long leg
back of a length on off stump, Hafeez flicks and has timed it rather well. Long leg runs across to keep it to two
bounce and seam for Shafiul! This back of a length delivery was in the channel and he draws Hafeez into poking at it.
fuller and outside off, Hafeez wades into an on-the-up cover drive and misses
full and wide outside off, third time proves the charm for Hafeez as he leans across and drives through point and cover
shortish and angled in on off stump, chopped behind point. Nasir dives and keeps it to a single
appeal for strangle down leg, but this has not touched bat. Shortish delivery angled down the pads. Hafeez was going for a flick and it grazes the thigh pad. Cloete hasn't spotted it
indecision! This was a length ball in the off-stump corridor. Hafeez is half-forward and was looking to defend, but then wanted to leave. The ball thuds into the face and runs down to third man
full on off stump, eased down the pitch
good length ball outside off and it straightens as Shehzad pushes at it. Beaten outside off. Bangladesh are getting this new ball to move a bit
another shortish delivery pushed down the leg side. Shehzad wanted a few easy runs to long leg, but can't connect
gorgeous stroke as he runs a length ball down to third man. Waited on the back foot and let it slide off the face
fullish and that open-chested action with his arms going everywhere will make him slip a few down leg. This gets runs off the front pad as he was looking to flick
137kph, just a little too full and Hafeez just extends his defence the perfect amount. Crispy timed push to the straight boundary. Classy stroke
plays quite late as this length ball straightens outside off. Defended off the back foot
134kph, this was full and swinging away as well. Doesn't bother Shehzad too much as he essays a magnificent square drive. Long stride forward and full swing of the bat as he admires the hit
good length ball on off stump, defended with soft hands
fullish and outside off, drives on the up to mid-off. He's looking quite confident out there
slower ball, wonderfully bowled! Shehzad is setting up for the drive through the off side and Shafiul offers a slow, wide off-cutter. Can't adjust and is beaten
too straight this time and Shehzad shuffles across and whips it to deep square leg. It went in the air, but there was no one close in
141kph, shortish on middle and leg, nudged in front of square leg. He's getting some decent bounce out there
short delivery but it isn't as wide as the batsman would like. Hafeez checks his stroke and cuts to cover
full on off stump, driven into the covers quite smartly. See, pretty but can he stay on?
that is glorious! Met the ball with a straight bat and then rolled his wrists to instill power into this stroke. Too full and straight from Al-Amin and the flick is from the best draw
137kph, back of a length and outside off, Hafeez trusts his form a little too much there as he looks for a back-foot punch. Little bit of away movement beats him
bouncer, just outside off. Hafeez is not drawn into playing
78kph, slower and tossed up outside off, Shehzad comes forward and blocks
lovely flight again as this is closer on off stump, Shehzad defence is solid
this goes on with the arm and has missed the stumps by inches!
goes back and pushes to mid-on
beaten outside off this time, lovely use of length from Shakib. He was trying to run it down to third man and is beaten
flighted on off stump and he keeps it out
a length ball on the pads, turned to the fielder at short fine leg
short of a length with width outside off, stands on his toes and cuts it in the air towards third man
shot, a fuller one outside off, and Hafeez presses forward and plays a classy square drive in front of point
another couple, driven through the off side
that's close, this ball swings in from a good length and takes the inside edge on to the front pad, Hafeez had pushed forward to play on the off side, left a gap between bat and pad
short of a length on the body, Hafeez swivels to pull but mis-times it
tucks him up on middle and leg, Shehzad pushes back to the bowler
makes room outside leg and punches to point
flighted a bit too much, Shehzad comes forward and takes it on the full. Driven to long-on
flighted and angled in at him. Hafeez waited so long that he almost seemed late on this shot. Manages to turn it to short fine leg
flighted outside off, draws Shehzad forward to a defensive
tossed up outside off, Shehzad keeps it out with a good stride forward
flighted on off stump, caressed to long-off
tossed up on middle, Shehzad is contend to defend back to the bowler
keeps his front foot out of the way of this one which is flighted on leg, eased into extra cover
flighted on off stump, pushed solidly to long-off as he places it wide of the bowler's dive
skips down the track but the bowler has seen him coming. Shortens his length and the slow pitch does the rest. The ball lobs back to Razzak and drops short of him

stays low as this is flatter and quicker. Hafeez is slow on the pull. That's why I think that leg gully is useless. he's not close enough to pick up a catch, nor is he deep enough to stop these deflections
goes back and pushes this flatter delivery to long-on
flighted on middle and leg, defended off the back foot
moves outside leg to slap this length ball from leg stump into the covers
tossed up on off stump, driven to mid-on.
this one doesn't turn! The skidder hits the inside edge and rolls away towards midwicket. Ill-judged cover drive amounts to nothing
flatter on off stump, goes back and punches to mid-off. Maiden to Shakib, what a match he's having!

nicely flighted on middle, Hafeez comes forward and blocks. Strikes it off the middle and yet the keeper appeals! Hafeez turns around and wonders what Anamul saw there. Tries not to catch the batsman's eye, but when he does, Anamul flashes a toothy grin
length ball on the pads and turned away to deep square leg
tossed up on off stump, defended off the front foot
goes back and pushes wide of mid-on
flighted on middle, lunges forward to defend
just a little bit of a mistake from Razzak and Hafeez has taken full toss. Rocks back and cuts through point and has placed it wide of the sweeper. Delicate stroke, perfect placement
that's the first boundary of Shakib and he immediately wants cover at deep third man. Waited on this flighted delivery and prefers to stay back as he dabs fine of short third man
loops it up on middle and leg, He was looking to nudge to midwicket and gets an inside edge onto pad. Ruins the appeal
only just a bit short and Shehzad goes deep in his crease and cuts to cover

tossed up nice and slow, I love the pace at which he's bowing and I also love this shot. He was on the front foot, waited for it to turn and dabs it away fine towards the third man boundary. Doesn't get enough bat on it though
flighted but this is down the leg side, goes for a sweep but he does not connect
flighted on middle and leg, he stays beside the ball and drives to short cover. The crowd thinks it's a catch and go up in a roar. Just a bump-ball though
flighted on leg stump, Hafeez advances and takes it on the full and clips to long-on
tossed up on off stump, dances down the track but has to settle for pushing it back to the bowler
shortish and on off stump, Shehzad backs away and cuts to the sweeper
gorgeous flight on off stump, Hafeez defends off the front foot
this is held back and Hafeez looks to flick it away, but is deceived
well done by Hafeez, picked away off his legs as this is short and angled down
clipped to deep midwicket as he starts off with a length ball on middle and leg
goes wide of the crease and pushes this length ball into the covers
tossed up outside off, Shehzad is forward and blocks
driven to short cover as this is flighted on off stump.
slower as this is given a bit more loop. Shehzad lunges forward and nudges to the short fine leg
too short and Hafeez pulls to deep midwicket. Pakistan are not hitting the gaps as often as they should
tossed up on middle, defended off the front foot
cut from the stumps! That was dangerous, but Shehzad manages it. This length ball skids on and could easily had flattened middle
pushed through on middle as he goes back and presents a straighter face. Better ploy
flighted but drifting down leg, Shehzad nudges square of short fine leg
drops it short on middle and Hafeez whips through wide mid-on. Seemed to keep a little low but Hafeez was using a straight bat
tossed up down the leg side, goes for a sweep but can't connect. The keeper can't collect
shortish with a bit of width and this is cut away quite handsomely. Waited on it just enough to get the placement perfectly behind point
flighted on middle, pushed back to the bowler
pushed through quicker on off stump, defended with an open face
goes down the track and he has laced this through the covers! Took it on the full and his timing is something to behold
goes down the track again but he shortens his length and forces the batsman to just defend
good length ball on the stumps, kept out

flighted on middle, he lunges forward and sweeps. Bisects short fine and deep square leg. Just as I wondered if Pakistan will ever find the gaps in the field, Hafeez pulls out two nearly perfect strokes
starts off with a dart ouside leg and Shehzad says thank you with a sweep. Made sure he was on top of the bounce and rolled his wrists
flighted outside off, dabbed behind point off the front foot
flighted outside off again as he lunges forward to defend
shortish, with the smallest bit of room and he dabs to the left of short third
flighted on off stump, strides forward to defend
a bit slower that time as he loops this outside off, Shehzad goes forward to push this into the covers but gets an inside edge and a single in front of square leg
flighted outside off, eased to point
flighted outside off, strides forward and pushes to mid-off.
easy single into the covers brings up Hafeez's fifty. Good stride forward to ensure the ball does not turn whatsoever. Another composed effort.
flighted outside off, he goes forward to defend
shortish and on middle, pushed back to the bowler
fired in quick and outside off, carved to deep point
bit of turn as he tossed it up outside off, Shehzad was down the track and defends. Gets a glove onto pad
nudged to midwicket as thsi is flighted on middle as well
flatter on middle and leg, eased to short fine leg
loads of flight on this one as Shehazad pushes into the covers
quicker and flatter on middle, Shezad goes back and was hurried into his defensive push
room outside off and his struggles at putting the ball away continue. Good slap, but straight to cover
room outside off and he dabs it to short third man
flighted on off stump, he goes forward and blocks to point
fired in at middle stump, Hafeez stays back and blocks
full and quick on off stump, defends but only to short cover.
nudged down the pitch as this is quicker and flatter on middle
punched to the left of short cover, but the fielder's quick enough to keep that to none. That's two maidens in a row and it is drinks
flighted outside off, leans into drive which goes straight to the cover fielder
makes room for himself to cut this length ball from the stumps. Third man mops up
flatter delivery outside off, Hafeez waits for it to turn and nudges to long leg
skips down the track but Mahmudullah is wary of the batsman's urgency. Pulls his length back and ensures it's only a single to long-on
charges the bowler again and the bowler adjusts his length appropriately. Worked towards long-on for a single
makes room and he has dabbed this just fine enough to beat the short third man fielder. Risky stroke, but Pakistan need them
flighted outside off as he makes the batsman reach out far away from his body. Dabbed to point
tossed up just outside off and this gets a little more bounce than he expects. Tries to run it down to third man, but is beaten
and this one stays low. Hafeez goes back to block this length ball into the leg side.

it was on the cards. Pakistan were piling too much pressure on themselves and Hafeez goes for a slog-sweep against the spin. But all he manages is a slice to long-on. Tight lines from Mominul as he attacks middle and leg, Hafeez had planted his front leg out of the way and swings, but doesn't make good enough contact
tossed up on middle, kept out
short and wide and Misbah has put it away to the point boundary. Stays balanced on the back foot and whips those wrists of his after getting on top of the ball to place it wide of the sweeper
lovely flight on off stump and Shehzad is once again content to defend
strides forward to drive this flighted delivery on off stump into the covers
mild appeal as Shehzad goes for the sweep. Gets a bit of an inside edge as this is given ample flight and drifts in on middle stump.
flighted on off stump, Misbah goes forward to block

Misbah's gone! Goes for an almighty heave over midwicket and he has been cleaned up. Bangladesh are ecstatic. What a good move by Mushi to bring back his strike bowler and Shakib does not disappoint. This is a skidder tossed up on off stump and Misbah has played all around it
flighted on leg stump, clipped wide of mid-on
length ball on off stump, punched into the covers
quicker and flatter on middle, Maqsood goes back to pull and connects. Good thing too, if he had not he would have been plumb in front
well-flighted outside off as he carves this away in front of point
shortish and outside off, Shehzad cuts to the sweeeper

two wickets in two overs, Mirpur has gone haywire and that's nothing compared to what the Bangladesh players are feeling! Amid all that, Maqsood has not touched this ball! This quicker delivery just outside off bounces and turns a bit too much for the cut shot and beats him completely. The keeper goes up straight away and Umpire Llong agrees. Maqsood just has a wry smile on his face as he takes it on the chin and walks off
flighted on leg stump, worked to short fine leg
good length ball on off stump, whips it around to deep square leg with the turn

lovely flight from Mahmudullah as he gets this to rip off the pitch. Alam was playing across the line with a closed face and is struck in front of middle, but the appeal is for naught as this has pitched outside leg
shortish and a bit outside off, he makes some room and cuts to cover
goes batter this time and is assisted by a bit more room outside off. Strong slap through the covers, born from his making room for himself and also from how far deep in the crease he had got
tossed up outside off and he drives to short cover
a bit short and he cuts straight to cover this time
fired in short and just outside off, goes for the cut and misses. Anamul appeals loudly again, this time no dice
flighted but goes down the leg side as he looks to sweep
tries to dab it between point and short third man with an open face
tossed up on middle and leg, Alam goes down on one knee and paddles it around the corner. Looks back to see if he was in line with the stumps before setting off
length ball on middle and leg, clipped away to square leg
flighted on middle and leg and he nudges to mid-on
shortish on middle, he goes back and works it through to deep square leg
tossed up outside leg and he dabs it to the right of short fine leg
flatter delivery on middle stump, too easy to whip that to deep square leg
moves around in his crease as he tries to upset the bowler. Mahmudullah is unfazed as he attacks the stumps. Punched through to deep cover
goes back to the shortish ball and cuts to deep point
flighted on off stump, Alam stays back and punches to long-off

that's an excellent effort at short fine leg. Mahmudullah races to his left and dives to keep this to a single. Terrible ball from Mominul as he drops it short and down leg side. Alam's sweep was heading for the boundary until the fielder intervened
flighted on middle and leg, defended
shortish and this turns outside off, but since it is slow, Shehzad waits on the back foot and whips it to long-on. Rather helicopter-ish that
flighted on middle, Alam nudges it behind square leg. He's keeping the score ticking nicely
short and wide, Shehzad goes back and cuts straight to the sweeper
flighted on off stump, defended towards midwicket
starts off with a short one, which turns off the deck. Shehzad was set up for the cut but has to adjust and present a straight bat to cover
more turn for Nasir as this is again shortish, Shehzad rides it as he goes back and punches to long-on
makes room outside leg and cuts this length ball from off stump
quicker and flatter on middle, Shehzad backs away but can only punch to the bowler
opens the face to slice this shortish delivery from outside off for the sweeper to clean up. That's fifty for Shehzad. He's been tied down quite noticeably, though
goes back and carves this length delivery from off stump to the sweeper again
flighted on off stump, defended to short cover
shortish and outside off, he rocks back and cuts to deep point
tossed up outside off and he dabs this square on the off side
pummeled to the midwicket boundary! This was in the slot and he strides forward and slog sweeps him away. Struck so powerfully that it almost carried past the ropes
and he makes the bowler bowl short and capitalises. Goes deep in his crease and smokes this to the midwicket boundary again
quick and flat on middle, whipped to long-on
good length ball on middle, he makes room and punches wide of mid-off
flighted on middle and off, defended off the front foot
not quite full enough so he goes back and pushes into the covers
takes his stance outside leg and then moves to cover his stumps, a la Chanders. Flighted on middle and leg, pushed just wide of mid-on
skips down the track to reach the pitch and launches him over mid-off. Nasir's not working out for Bangladesh
quick dart on leg stump, he goes back and punches to the bowler
short and wide and he's found the gap with a rasping cut shot. Alam's looking quite good out there as he hits this well behind point but well wide of deep third man
pushes him back with a shortish ball angled in at him. He's almost pushed off his feet, but has managed to work this away to long long
magnificent timing! The extra pace works for Pakistan as they string together a few quick runs here. This was shortish with a bit of room and he's just slapped it through to the point boundary.
slower ball just outside off, waits on it and cuts to deep third man. That's the fifty partnership between these two
bouncer on middle and off, Alam doesn't bother with it
opens up his stance and that assist in helping him confuse the bowler. Shuffles across to get in line with the stumps as Shafiul bowls length and down leg

blocks to mid-on and he sets off straight away. The bowler was rushing across to cut it off which was why Shehzad waits. Alam was almost halfway down but as soon as it passes the bowler Shehzad sets off to without realising mid-on was in. Could have been an easy run out had that underarm throw from Mahmudullah hit the stumps
length ball on middle and leg, defended
gives room outside off and Shehzad cuts to deep point
slows this up on middle and leg, Alam is on the front foot and works it through midwicket
oh, this is lovely! Dances down the track while making room for himself and caresses this over extra cover. Hit with the turn and struck with impressive timing
this was all power. The bowler drags his length short and Shehzad was waiting on it. Rocks back and pulls through to the midwicket boundary
waits on this shortish ball outside off and cuts, but still cannot beat point
advances and though Razzak fires this down leg, he reaches it and presents a straight bat to push it to long-on
fullish on middle and off, pushed down the ground to long-on
he's mimicking Chanders again. Takes guard with an open stance on leg stump and then shuffles across to this back of a length delivery outside off. Misses with a cut
not this time. Orthodox stance from Alam as he rode the bounce and pace on this short ball outside off. Hoists it over the top and has beaten the dive of the sweeper
much tighter on middle and off, Alam's rooted to his crease as he blocks
stands way outside leg again before going across to the length ball outside off. Opens the face to run it down to point and Shehzad calls him through. Tight single

sets up outside off and has swiped this to the midwicket boundary. Length ball vanishes. While Alam tries moving leg side to confuse the bowler, he goes the other way. Shaiful offers just about the perfect ball for a batsman in that position and is bludgeoned
clipped in front of short fine leg. Razzak is firing darts in on middle and off
flighted outside off but he goes for the sweep. Not the best shot for the line of this ball. Beaten
good length ball on middle and off, Shehzad moves back and across and pushes to long-on. They call for two and excellent running does the rest. Mahmudullah falls on his shoulder, but looks okay
flighted on middle and off ,he turns it away behind square on the leg side
length ball on off stump, rocks back and thumps it back to the bowler. Goes off the bottom of the bat
flighted on middle, defended

helped over the long-leg boundary! Again he was moving outside off stump and the bowler does not adjust. Another simple put away for Shehzad as he uses the pace of the bowler. Add to that the fine leg was inside the circle
whip through square leg as he gets on top of the bounce of a shortish delivery on off stump
full on the stumps as he pushes down the ground. It deflects off his boot towards mid-off. Had that hit the stumps, Shehzad would have been out
moves outside leg and this time he slows his pace and bowls this in the off stump channel. Shehzad goes for a cut, but is beaten by the lack of pace
yorker on off stump, Shehzad nudges towards midwicket
takes stance well outside leg and them moves in line with a fuller delivery outside off and pushes into the covers
it's the day for full-tosses from spinners. Shehzad comfortably bunts this to long-on
pushed full and wide outside off, Alam goes deep in his crease to try and cut, but misses
flighted on middle but he premeditated a sweep. No power in the stroke though
length ball, whipped off his pads, but doesn't beat square leg
flighted outside off and he pushes towards mid-off. The bowler rushes across and fields it himself
goes to 99 by turning a flighted delivery in front of the midwicket region
flighted outside off and he drives to long-off to pick up the single that gives him a century. No fanfare about it though as he gives a thumbs-up to his partner. Doesn't even raise his bat
worked away off his pads behind square leg
shortish and he makes a little bit of room, but the cut shot finds cover
flighted on off stump, he lofts it over the bowler's head for a single to long-off
cuts off middle and leg! There is no one in the deep on the off side and he has bowled length. Alam's footwork turns this into a bad ball as he thumps through extra
tossed up on middle, he goes down on one-knee and laps to short fine leg. That's drinks
flighted on leg stump, nudged in front of square leg
flighted outside off, he digs it out to short third man. Searched for the single but has to go back
flighted on middle, he clears the front leg and slams it back to the bowler. Shakib stops it with his left hand and it is noticeably stinging
flighted on leg stump, turned away to deep midwicket
makes room outside leg, Shakib offers a low full toss which is drilled through extra cover
flighted on off stump, turned away behind square leg
flighted on middle, whipped away to deep square leg for a couple! Alam is playing a lovely little gem here.
flighted on middle and this time he opens the face and guides to point. I daresay this was the same delivery as the last one

makes room outside leg and he's yorked himself! Anamul Haque lets out a war-cry, Mirpur has woken up! Razzak though looks thoroughly disenchanted with the emotion after bowling a beauty! he's seen the batsman moving in his crease and fires in a middle stump yorker. Shehzad tries to jam a horizontal bat down in time to stop it, but does not succeed
flighted on leg stump as he stays inside the line and works towards long leg
moves all over the crease and in the end top-edges a full toss onto his grilled
fullish on leg stump, clipped away past short fine leg
good length ball just outside off, goes back to cut but it was too full
full and wide outside off, slices this to the right of cover and he has set off for a single. Amazing running from Alam
skips down the track and long-off was racing in and dives forward, but spills a touch chance. Didn't get to the pitch but went through with the shot
inside edge to short fine leg as this is pushed through very quick on off stump. Swings his bat around in disgust as he reaches the non-strikers'
shortish and outside off, he clears his front leg and cuts between point and cover
full and fired in on middle, Rehman goes down the track and swings across the line. Big appeal for leg before but to no avail
seeks the block hole on middle stump, Rehman heaves and gets a thick inside edge through to deep square leg
flighted outside off, Alam cant drive it past the bowler. Good effort by Nasir to run across to his right
full and outside off, he strides forward and drives to long-off
skips down the track to reach the pitch and lofts to long-on. The fielder is too deep and the throw is off balance so they take a couple
goes down the track and almost yorks himself as this is punched to extra cover
low full toss well outside off, did well to reach that and slice to deep point

walks right across the stumps and he sweeps it. Gets a top-edge but the man at square leg has not judged it well. Over runs it and has to backtrack and by that time, the ball has sailed over Mushi, the captain. Says he did  not sight it

holes out to long-on as he goes for a slog down the ground. There was too much with on this, plus it was turning away as well. This was always a poor choice of shot and he succumbs. Might actually be good for Pakistan that that experiment ended sooner than later

no need for sighters! he did not connect it off the middle, but this still sails over the short boundary at long-on! Had room to swing his arms and so he did. Long-on was setting himself up, but it was always going over his head
shortish on middle and leg, clipped between deep square leg and deep midwicket for a couple. Lovely running
mammoth strike! He makes room outside leg and has blasted this into the stands. What a strike! Got underneath it and once that was done there was only one result
flighted outside off as he moves across and whips to deep square leg
sails over wide long-on. Afridi's power is unbelievable! This was full on middle stump and he sinks down on one knee to whack it away
pushes to the sweeper and races across to complete the couple
full and outside off, Afridi moves across and sweeps to square leg. Powerful wrists
smoked over long-off. Bangladesh are in tatters! This is full and outside off, Afridi is on the front foot and muscles it over long-off
slows it up but that doesn't bother Afridi one bit! Slog sweeps him over square leg. Pure, alarming, breathtaking power!
slows it up even more and this flighted delivery grips and turns outside off to beat his outside edge as Afridi looks to defend. Anamul appeals for the stumping, but his back foot was safe
full and wide, Alam smears it to deep point to give the strike back to Boom Boom
128kph, that's brave and he's rewarded for it. Slower ball outside off and Afridi just pokes at it. Beaten outside off
shortish and outside off, Afridi shuffles across and whips to midwicket
cuts the length ball from middle stump. he's been very good with that shot.
slower ball outside off, dabbed to short third man
full and wide outside off, jams his bat down to guide this to extra cover and retains strike
there's his fifty, on comeback. He injected momentum into the chase and is still out there. Very composed effort. This was a wide yorker and he dug it out to the man at cover
131 kph, fullish and outside off. Afridi was walking across to whip through midwicket. Goes through between bat and pad.
full and outside off, he stays beside the ball and carves it away over extra cover. Couple of bounces for four
smashed over midwicket! It was a length ball outside off, Afridi had walked across and forward and has simply massacred it. One ball left to join Jayasuriya as the fastest half-centurion in ODIs
slower ball pushed wide of off stump. Too much so as Afridi lets it go
again walks at him as he moved outside off. Shaiful digs it short and he lets it go through to the keeper again

fine leg was inside the circle and he has pulled it to the boundary! That's joint second-fastest fifty in ODIs for Afridi. This time the short ball doesn't surprise him, goes through with the shot and how. That's his third fifty off 18 balls
tossed up on middle as he charges him. Whipped only as far as midwicket though
this time he beats the man. Waited just a bit more to beat Mushfiqur at midwicket, who was the only man inside the circle
full and wide outside leg. Afridi knows he doesn't need to play at that. Even Shakib is rattled
full and just outside off, Afridi stays put and dabs into the covers for a quick single
low full toss outside off, flays it to long-off

Anamul is so certain there was a nick that he was celebrating like they'd already won the game. Umpire Cloete is unmoved and rightly so. Afridi was making room outside leg and this was fired in full and outside off. There is miles of daylight between bat and pad. The keeper wears a bemused look. Poor fellow, far too excitable
yorker and it misses the leg stump by a whisker! Makes room to carve it over cover but misses again. Another very good delivery to keep him quiet
slower ball outside off, goes for a heave and misses. Afridi is struggling here. Seems his leg is cramping up

straight up in the air and the captain's dropped it at short cover! A few girls in the crowd are crying here! Held it back and that was enough to make Afridi miscue the slog. Goes off the very bottom of the bat and it was a skier. But by all accounts this should have been taken
wide yorker which is sliced to the sweeper

length ball outside off, Afridi moves outside off and scoops it over the fine leg boundary! he's wobbling out there but it seems even an injured Afridi has what it takes to send the ball over the boundary!
very full outside off, he is forward and drills this to mid-off. They set off for the single, even with Afridi struggling to move out there. A direct hit from mid-off finds him short and Mirpur roars
charges down the track to meet this on the full and carves this to the sweeper. Two taken
flighted on leg stump, nudged to long-on for a single
in the slot and he's mauled this over wide long-on! Full on middle, he gets under it after clearing his front leg and wallops it over the rope
speared in on leg stump and this has been worked to long leg
another one! This one goes into the Pakistan team in the dug out! That's Alam's highest score. Length ball on middle and he's heaved this over midwicket. The third six of his ODI career
full toss on off stump, slashed to cover who misfields. Alam dives to make his ground at the other end. Desperate stuff
low full toss on off stump, Akmal whips it and bisects long-on and deep midwicket for a couple. Gorgeous placement
almost a yorker on middle and leg, Alam opens the face towards cover for an easy single
smashed over cover! This was a loopy delivery outside off and Akmal stays leg side of it and slaps it inside out to the boundary
flighted on middle as he presses forward to block into the covers and race across for a single
cut away to point as this is a length ball on off stump. Akmal is too quick and the single is completed quite comfortably
flighted and it dips on middle, Akmal sweeps to deep square leg
nudged to deep square leg and he is strong enough to run two again. There's been so many things impressive about this innings from Alam and his ability to convert ones into twos is chief among them.
back of a length and just outside off, guided to point.
races down the track to whack this length ball to the next city. Made too much room to connect and Alam walks up to calm his partner down. Only three needed after all, no need for such rash strokes
opens the face and carves this length ball on off stump to the sweeper in the deep

137 kph, Alam was backing away and the bowler bowls it short and slides it across him. Looks to ramp it over third man but doesn't connect. The keeper dribbles the ball through and the bowler breaks the stumps at the other end. There was lots of height on that bouncer though, very close to being a wide
slogged to the midwicket boundary and Pakistan complete their biggest chase in Pakistan history to seal a spot in the Asia Cup final! It was length, it had room outside off and it was banished
